Selenium/Advanced Concepts/Cookies.description: Cookies in Selenium manage session data, authentication tokens, and user preferences across browser sessions.

Selenium/Advanced Concepts/Fetch Dimensi.description: COMPLETE WebElement Dimensions \& Position - Selenium 4 Methods

Selenium/Advanced Concepts/Multiple Wind.title: Multiple Window Handles
Selenium/Advanced Concepts/Multiple Wind.description: Selenium 4 introduces switchTo().newWindow() - the cleanest way to open and switch to new tabs/windows in a single call.

Selenium/Advanced Concepts/Screenshots.title: Screenshots
Selenium/Advanced Concepts/Screenshots.description: Screenshots capture visual state for debugging, reporting, and visual regression testing.

Selenium/Locators/Advanced Locators.title: Advanced Locators
Selenium/Locators/Advanced Locators.description: Here is a detailed list of different types of XPath and CSS selectors that you can include in the introduction to Selenium locators:

Selenium/Locators/Common Locators.title: Common Locators
Selenium/Locators/Common Locators.description: Locators in Selenium WebDriver are methods used to identify and locate web elements on a webpage so that actions like clicking, typing, or validating can be performed. Since web pages consist of many elements, locators allow Selenium to precisely find the right element for interaction.

Selenium/Locators/Relative Locators.title: Relative Locators
Selenium/Locators/Relative Locators.description: Relative locators in Selenium 4 let you find an element based on its position relative to another element: above, below, toLeftOf, toRightOf, or near.

Selenium/Realtime Practical Exercises/Li.title: Links
Selenium/Realtime Practical Exercises/Li.description: To count links on a page, count links in a specific section like footer, open each link in a new tab using Ctrl+Enter, and then get all page titles, use findElements, section scoping, Keys.chord, and window-handle iteration in Selenium WebDriver with Java.

Selenium/Synchronization/Intoduction.title: Intoduction
Selenium/Synchronization/Intoduction.description: ðŸ“Œ What is Synchronization in Selenium?

Selenium/Web Elements/Auto Suggestive Dr.title: Suggestive Dropdown
Selenium/Web Elements/Auto Suggestive Dr.description: Selenium WebDriver can automate suggestive dropdowns (auto-suggest/typeahead dropdowns) in Java by interacting with dynamic elements that appear as the user types. These elements often load options asynchronously based on input, and require careful handling to ensure accurate selection.

Selenium/Web Elements/Button.title: Button
Selenium/Web Elements/Button.description: Buttons are clickable elements that trigger actions like form submission or navigation. They are typically represented by `, , `, or other clickable elements styled as buttons.

Selenium/Web Elements/Check Boxes.title: Check Boxes
Selenium/Web Elements/Check Boxes.description: Selenium WebDriver provides robust automation for checkboxes in Java, enabling both single and multiple selections in web forms. Checkboxes use the `` HTML element and can be selected or deselected as needed.

Selenium/Web Elements/File Upload.title: File Upload
Selenium/Web Elements/File Upload.description: Uploading files on web pages usually involves interacting with an ` element. Selenium WebDriver automates file uploads by sending the fileâ€™s absolute path to this element using sendKeys()`.

Selenium/Web Elements/File Upload using.id: Selenium/Web Elements/File Upload using Auto IT
Selenium/Web Elements/File Upload using.title: File Upload using Auto IT
Selenium/Web Elements/File Upload using.description: AutoIt scripts allow controlling Windows-based dialogs like file upload windows, which Selenium has no direct access to since they are outside the browser DOM.

Selenium/Web Elements/Images.title: Images
Selenium/Web Elements/Images.description: Images in HTML are represented by the ` tag. Automating images mainly involves verifying their presence, checking attributes like src and alt`, and validating if they are loaded properly on the page.

Selenium/Web Elements/Multi Select Drop.title: Multi-Select Dropdown
Selenium/Web Elements/Multi Select Drop.description: Selenium WebDriver can automate multi-select dropdowns in Java by leveraging the Select class, which is specifically designed to interact with standard ` elements containing the multiple` attribute. Multi-select dropdowns allow selecting multiple options simultaneously and are common in forms for choosing categories, tags, etc.

Selenium/Web Elements/Progress Bar.title: Progress Bar
Selenium/Web Elements/Progress Bar.description: Progress bars visually indicate the progress of processes such as file uploads or data loading. In web apps, they are usually implemented with HTML elements styled and updated dynamically using JavaScript or CSS.

Selenium/Web Elements/Radio Button.title: Radio Button
Selenium/Web Elements/Radio Button.description: Selenium WebDriver allows detailed automation of radio buttons in web forms using Java. Radio buttons are represented by `` and are designed for single-choice selections within a group.

Selenium/Web Elements/Sliders.title: Sliders
Selenium/Web Elements/Sliders.description: Sliders are UI elements that allow users to choose a value from a range by dragging a handle along a track. They often use the `` element or custom HTML with JavaScript for visual and functional behavior.

Selenium/Web Elements/Static DropDown.title: Static DropDown
Selenium/Web Elements/Static DropDown.description: The Selenium Select class in Java is used to automate interactions with dropdown elements (both single-select and multi-select) on web pages. Below are practical examples covering the most common operations with Select class in Selenium WebDriver.

Selenium/Web Elements/Text Box.title: Text Boxes
Selenium/Web Elements/Text Box.description: Text boxes (input fields) allow users to enter text data in web forms. They are typically represented by HTML ` elements with types like text, password, email, etc., or ` elements.

Selenium/Web Elements/Toggle Switch.title: Toggle Switch
Selenium/Web Elements/Toggle Switch.description: A toggle switch is a modern UI control that functions like a checkbox but provides an enhanced visual representation for ON/OFF states (e.g., dark mode switches, settings toggles). Selenium WebDriver automation for toggle switches in Java is similar to checkbox automation, though the underlying HTML and classes are often styled for appearance rather than using a standard checkbox element.

Selenium/Web Elements/Tool Tips.title: Tool Tips
Selenium/Web Elements/Tool Tips.description: Tooltips are small messages that appear when hovering over an element, providing additional information. In HTML, tooltips are often created using the title attribute or dynamically via JavaScript and CSS.

TestNG/Annotations & Execution Flow.title: Annotations & Execution Flow
TestNG/Annotations & Execution Flow.description: TestNG uses annotations to define the lifecycle of test execution.

TestNG/Dependencies.title: Dependencies
TestNG/Dependencies.description: In real-world automation, some tests cannot or should not run independently.

TestNG/Groups.title: Groups
TestNG/Groups.description: Groups in TestNG allow you to categorize test cases and execute only the required set of tests.

TestNG/Helper Attributes.title: Helper Attributes
TestNG/Helper Attributes.description: TestNG helper attributes are additional properties used inside @Test (and some configuration annotations) to control execution behavior, flow, retries, timing, and documentation.

TestNG/Introduction.title: Introduction
TestNG/Introduction.description: TestNG is a powerful testing framework for Java used to design, execute, and manage automated tests efficiently.

TestNG/Listeners and RetryAnalyzer.title: Listeners and RetryAnalyzer
TestNG/Listeners and RetryAnalyzer.description: TestNG Listeners & Retry Handling â€” Complete Guide

TestNG/Parallel Exection.title: Parallel Execution
TestNG/Parallel Exection.description: Parallel execution allows TestNG to run multiple tests at the same time instead of sequentially.

TestNG/Priority.title: Priority
TestNG/Priority.description: Priority in TestNG is used to control the execution order of test methods within the same class.

TestNG/TestNG Assertions.title: TestNG Assertions
TestNG/TestNG Assertions.description: Assertions in TestNG â€“ Hard vs Soft

TestNG/Why TestNG.title: Why TestNG?
TestNG/Why TestNG.description: After understanding what TestNG is, the next important question is why TestNG is widely used in real-world automation projects.
